org.corfudb.runtime.object

Class VersionLockedObject<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.corfudb.runtime.object.VersionLockedObject<T>

  • public class VersionLockedObject<T>
extends Object
    The version locked object keeps track of where -- in the history of updates -- is the current state of the underying object. it maintains a shallow undo-log, back to the earliest open-transaction's snapshot. it also maintains an optimistic undo-log, for the current open-transaction, if any.

    Created by mwei on 11/13/16.

        public int getOptimisticVersionUnsafe()

      • clearOptimisticUpdatesUnsafe

        protected void clearOptimisticUpdatesUnsafe()
        Clears all data about applied optimistic updates, including the optimistic undo log.

      • optimisticCommitUnsafe

        public void optimisticCommitUnsafe(long version)
        Commits all optimistic changes as a new version.

      • optimisticRollbackUnsafe

        public void optimisticRollbackUnsafe()
        Rollback any optimistic changes, if possible. Unsafe, requires that the caller has acquired a write lock.

      • rollbackUnsafe

        public void rollbackUnsafe(long version)
        Roll the object back to the supplied version if possible. This function may roll back to a point prior to the requested version. Otherwise, throws a NoRollbackException. Unsafe, requires that the caller has acquired a write lock.
        Parameters:
        version - The version to rollback to.
        Throws:
        NoRollbackException - If the object cannot be rolled back to the supplied version.

      • applyUndoRecord

        protected void applyUndoRecord(SMREntry record)
        Given a SMR entry with an undo record, undo the update.
        Parameters:
        record - The record to undo.

      • needUndoRecordUnsafe

        public boolean needUndoRecordUnsafe()
        Calculate the number of undo records we need to keep, possibly cleaning up the undo log, and return whether we need to keep this undo record.
        Returns:
        True, if an undo record is needed in the undo log, False otherwise.

      • applyUpdateUnsafe

        public Object applyUpdateUnsafe(SMREntry entry,
                                boolean isOptimistic)
        Apply an SMR update to the object, possibly optimistically, if set.
        Parameters:
        entry - The entry to apply.
        isOptimistic - Whether the update is optimistic or not.
        Returns:
        The upcall result, if available.

        Execute the given function under a write lock, not returning anything.
        Parameters:
        writeFunction - The function to execute under the write lock.

        Parameters:

        public void resetStreamViewUnsafe()
        Reset the stream view backing this object. This function also resets the undo log, since it's based on the current position in the stream view.
